newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Robotics up after profit, revenue surprises.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Robotics up after profit, revenue surprises.

text.p: The stock of U.S. Robotics Corp. gained almost 9 percent Tuesday after the computer modem maker pleasantly surprised Wall Street late Monday by reporting that its profits and revenues doubled in its fiscal fourth quarter.
Shares of U.S. Robotics jumped $5.25 to $64.75 in very heavy morning trading on the Nasdaq market, where they were the most actively traded issue.
On Monday, after the market closed, U.S. Robotics said its net income for the three months ended Sept. 30 jumped to $67.47 million, or 71 cents a share, from $34.22 million, or 37 cents a share.
The per-share earnings matched Wall Street estimates of 71 cents a share, according to First Call, which tracks analysts' estimates.
U.S. Robotics also said its revenues expanded in the period to $611.4 million from $293.4 million.
"It was a great quarter -- in line with expectations is the best way to describe it," Volpe, Welty & Co analyst Amar Senan said Monday evening.

"Overall they managed to pull the rabbit out of the hat, at least for the quarter," said Rakesh Sood, an analyst for Hambrecht & Quist. "People were pretty bearish all the way around and were thinking they wouldn't hit their numbers."
For the full year U.S. Robotics said its net income soared to $224.02 million, or $2.36 a share, from $89.15 million, or $1.05 a share, as revenues jumped to $1.98 billion from $889.3 million.
